text:
RADIO STATION KUSD
UNIVERSITY OF SOUTH DAKOTA
VERMILLION
April 2, 1956
TO : NAEB Acceptance Subcommittee
Bob Underwood, Network Manager
Waldo Abbot, WUOM
John Regnell, WILL
Hugh Mix, WNAD
FROM: Jim Slack, KUSD
SUBJECT: Georgetown Radio Forum, Hello Neighbor, The
Lively Arts.
GEORGETOWN RADIO FORUM: I think they do a fine job at
Georgetown with their forum. Certainly they have an almost
inexhaustible supply of qualified people for any number of
discussions. Vote "yes".
HELLO NEIGHBOR: A little bit too amateurish for my blood.
The production was spotty in many instances and the girl
narrator of this program didn't add much to the whole. Have
to vote "no" on this one.
THE LIVELY ARTS : I am strongly tempted by this one but it
appears disorganized to me. Is there some way the program
might be re-evaluated so that we have a good clear introÂ¬
duction of topic and speaker. Program has merit potentially
but needs polishing before I give it a yes vote. In the
meantime, a tentative "no".
